intro: Wisteria frutescens var. backhouseana, commonly known as the Chinese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to China. It features long, pendulous clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has compound leaves with 12–20 oval-shaped leaflets, and its stems are covered in soft, grayish bark. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. However, it can be invasive in some regions if not properly managed.
